page.title: 10PAST MEMORIES OF SCHOOL 2
page.content: According to the people we interviewed Fridays were the days to looked forward to. This was because cooking and woodwork were taught. But unlike today cooking was only for the girls and woodwork for the boys. The headmaster was then the most important man in the village and all the children feared him. The leaving age in those days was 14. Mrs Clayton said she went to the Grammar School at 15. We were told that Miss Connie Marshall was a young teacher who was kind to the children. They used to have a tennis court but it was a privilege and only the older children went on it. They used to do drill every morning. This was exercises. We decided that perhaps schooling today is better. Written by Jenny Millin
